resources.string: has been pinned to the Launcher
has been unpinned from the Launcher
How wide the Launcher and the icons within it should be. The slider goes from 48dip to 120dip, with the default (right in the middle) being 84dip.
How opaque the background color of icons in the Launcher should be.
Make the Launcher available inside other apps

When you swipe from the bottom half of the left edge of the screen, the Launcher will appear, allowing you to launch apps which you have pinned to the Launcher without having to go to the home screen.\n(EXPERIMENTAL)
Whether the Panel at the top of the screen should be shown or not.
How opaque the Panel should be.

Dynamically pick the background color of transparent Unity components (Launcher, and the Dash and Panel when the Dash is opened) based on the dominant color of the wallpaper. This won\'t work when a live wallpaper is set, in which case it will fall back to a transparent black.
The background color that should be used for transparent Unity components.
Use the sliders to pick a color.
How opaque the background color of transparent Unity components should be.
The method that should be used to blur the background when the Dash is opened. When \"Downscale & upscale\" is chosen and it fails (or a live wallpaper is set), \"Darken\" will be used as fallback.
Taking more samples greatly increases accuracy but can result in longer loading times on slower devices.

Using HSV (Hue, Saturation, Value) instead of plain RGB (Red, Green, Blue) will result in colors being much more vibrant, but the calculations that are being preformed are more complicated which can result in longer loading times on slower devices.

Enabling this option will result in better Dash search results but will also affect performance on slower devices or devices with a lot of apps installed. If Dash search is slow for you, you might want to consider disabling this.
* Testing (If he doesn\'t manage to wreck it then it\'s probably safe for consumption by the rest of the world.)\n * Help with the dominant color calculation function.
* I used his ProgressWheel component, since the default (round) Android ProgressBar component can\'t actually indicate progress.\n https://github.com/Todd-Davies/ProgressWheel/
* I used his ExpandableHeightGridView component.\n http://stackoverflow.com/a/8483078/521361
* I used his ColorMixer component in the Preferences screen.\n https://github.com/commonsguy/cwac-colormixer
